info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 25 at 1:46AM EDT until July 25 at 2:45AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Mercer County in northwestern Pennsylvania... Western Venango County in northwestern Pennsylvania... * Until 245 AM EDT. * At 146 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Greenville, or 14 miles northeast of Sharpsville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Hermitage, Sharon, Franklin, Sharpsville, Greenville, Sugarcreek, Farrell, Mercer, Stoneboro, West Middlesex, Polk, and Sandy Lake. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM EDT for northwestern Pennsylvania. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
